The first chapter of M. Redhead’s Incompleteness, Non-Locality and Realism

is a self-contained introduction to the formalism, but at a much faster pace. The rest of Redhead’s book is a systematic study of the constraints on hidden variables posed by quantum mechanics, whether by violation of the Bell inequalities, or by other, algebraic constraints. Similar ground, but on a more general (geometric and logical) plane, is covered by I. Pitowsky’s Quantum Probability–Quantum Logic
Neither Redhead nor Pitowsky discuss the pilot-wave theory (nor, indeed, special relativity) explicitly
